metadata.titel_preek: The Trinitarian Blessing and the Depths of Mercy

kernfrasen: parent of a child... on the verge of self-destruction
pay a ransom, mortgage the house
enough credits to come into the presence of God
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: SIN IS DEBT / SALVATION IS DEBT CANCELLATION

kernfrasen: there is no health in us
erred and strayed like lost sheep

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: You would pay a ransom, mortgage the house... to get your child’s attention.

cognitieve_implicaties: God is willing to lose everything for the hearer
theologische_implicaties: The Trinity is not a static doctrine but a dynamic rescue mission
onbedoelde_consequenties: God might be seen as reckless or lacking sovereignty

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Re-activates the dead metaphor of 'ransom' by grounding it in the visceral anxiety of a parent with a drug-addicted child.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher successfully bridges the Juridical/Economic metaphors of Psalm 130 with the Relational metaphors of 2 Corinthians by framing 'debt' and 'law' as symptoms of 'estrangement' from a Father.

incoherentie_punten.metafoor_a: SIN IS SICKNESS (no health in us)
incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The preacher laments the loss of 'no health in us' while simultaneously emphasizing 'offenders'.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: A sick person needs a doctor (pity); an offender needs a judge (punishment).

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The 'Ransom' is motivated by 'Parental Love', transforming a cold transaction into an act of passion.

sterktes.beschrijving: Takes the 'Trinitarian Formula' (often a dead liturgical metaphor) and re-embodies it through the image of an 'agonized' Paul and a desperate parent.
sterktes.voorbeeld: The church that was breaking his heart is the one that gets the full Trinitarian blessing.

risicos.beschrijving: By comparing God's love to a parent of an addict, there is a risk of reducing God to a co-dependent figure.
risicos.voorbeeld: make a complete fool of yourself if you thought it might get your child’s attention.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may lose the sense of God's 'incomprehensible majesty'.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A modern household in crisis (addiction, anorexia, runaway).
sub_worlds: The 'crabbed, tumultuous' writing desk of the Apostle Paul
The 'depths' (De Profundis) of a prison or hospital bed
The watchman waiting for the dawn

deictic_shifts.van_wereld: The relational space of the Trinity
deictic_shifts.naar_wereld: The juridical space of the 'tax collector' and 'record keeping'
deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Strong contrast highlighting the need for the previously established love.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Using the 'vast primordial catastrophe' and 'no health in us' language.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Repudiating 'petty record keeping' and 'adding up points'.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly connected to the Book of Common Prayer and the history of the General Confession.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by a powerful shift from Relational (Parent/Child) to Juridical/Economic (Debt/Record) domains. It uses the Relational domain to provide the 'why' (God's character) and the Juridical domain to provide the 'what' (the seriousness of the human condition).

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Connect 'redemption' more explicitly to the 'mortgaging the house' imagery used earlier.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: God 'liquidating' his heavenly assets to buy back a child from the 'street' of sin.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Use the metaphor of 'Addiction' as a bridge—it is both a disease (no health) and involves personal choices (offense).

entailment_checks.metafoor: GOD IS A FOOL FOR LOVE
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Clarify that this 'folly' is the 'wisdom of the cross' (1 Cor 1), not actual incompetence.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To ground the 'upholding the universe' phrase in something more concrete than 'love'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using CMT to breathe life into the Trinity and the concept of Sin through the source domain of parental desperation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: An aesthetic analysis would praise the 'crabbed, tumultuous' description; CMT shows how that description functions as a source domain for the 'Target' of Paul's theological agony.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's learning styles, CMT focuses on the neurological mapping of 'depths' to 'despair' regardless of the hearer's preferred style.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT reveals that the preacher is using 'Verticality' (Out of the depths / raise up eyes) as the primary spatial scaffold for the entire second half of the sermon.

appendices.notities: The preacher relies heavily on the 'CONTAINER' schema when discussing being 'in' the depths or 'in' the Trinity.
